#### PROBLEM 1

Since $p(x)=\sin(x)$ the $CDF$ is calculated as:

\[\int_0^{x} \sin w~dw\] which yields:
\[F(x)=1-\cos(x)\] 
and using the inverse CDF Transform:

\[u=1-\cos(F^{-1}(u))\] 
\[F^{-1}(u)=\arccos(1-u)\]


```{r PROBLEM 1}

set.seed(123)
u<-runif(n=10000)
x<-acos(1-u)
y<-seq(0,pi/2,0.1)
f<-1-cos(y)
hist(x,freq = F)
lines(y,f,col="red")
```
#### PROBLEM 2

$p(x)=\lambda x^{-\lambda -1}$ therefore:
\[\int_0^{x} w^{-\lambda -1}~dw\] which yields:
\[F(x)=-x^{-\lambda}\]
Using the inversion method:
\[F^{-1}=\sqrt[-\lambda]{-u}\]
